title: Chamith Wijesundera questions Government’s commitment to integrity
byline: Chamith Wijesundera, National Youth Organizer of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), has called for decisive action against candidates who provide false qualifications or spread misinformation to gain votes.

title: Adani Group dealings with other countries not Sri Lanka’s concern – President
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said his government is not concerned with Adani Group’s dealings with other countries but is instead focused only on what the conglomerate does in Sri Lanka.

title: Remaining Sri Lankans at cyber camps in Myanmar to be repatriated
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said it is collaborating with relevant authorities to ensure the swift rescue and repatriation of Sri Lankans still trapped in Myanmar.

title: Expressway exits accept only local currency, inconveniencing tourists and locals: Official
byline: Tourists and the local community face inconvenience when making payments at expressway toll gates, as they currently accept only Sri Lankan currency, the Daily Mirror has learnt.

title: Sri Lanka’s internet subscriptions hit 26mn connections
byline: The number of internet subscriptionsin Sri Lanka, including mobile internet connections, has risen to 26 million units by the end of the second quarter of 2024, according to local analytics platform Charts.lk.

title: Leopard killed and head taken away
byline: A hill country leopard, frequently seen in the shrub jungle adjacent to Pordias Estate in Hatton, was killed, and its head and limbs were cut off and taken away.

title: Mihintale Chief Incumbent acquitted
byline: Chief Incumbent of the Mihintale Rajamaha Vihara, Ven. Walawahengunawewe Dhammarathana Thera, who was charged with the alleged assault of a tour guide within the temple’s central compound, causing injuries, was acquitted by Anuradhapura Additional Magistrate Ms. P.H.W.D.L. Samarasinghe.

title: Delhi pollution: Cold air and toxic haze affect millions
byline: Delhi’s pollution has once again soared to hazardous levels, with a top expert warning that India’s toxic air will have a bigger impact on public health than the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Heart disease age in Sri Lanka drops to 17: Specialist
byline: The age of those suffering from heart disease in Sri Lanka is gradually decreasing and the age limit has now reached 17, National Hospital specialist Indika de Lanerolle said today.

title: Did Minister Samarasinghe accept Namal’s challenge to step down?
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa today (18) challenged Minister of Trade Wasantha Samarasinghe to step down from his ministerial portfolio if ’’he (Wasantha) fails to prove that I (Namal) took the law exam alone in an A/C room,’’

title: I am a degree holder, says Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa claimed today that he is a degree holder and tabled all his certificates in Parliament.

title: Belgium-based NGO claims Israel soldier ’terminator’ in Sri Lanka
byline: Belgium-based NGO Hind Rajab Foundation has accused that Gal Ferenbook, an Israeli soldier allegedly responsible for the death of a Palestinian civilian and the degrading treatment of the body, is now in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

title: Keheliya Rambukwella’s two bank accounts with Rs. 20 million suspended
byline: A current account and a fixed deposit account belonging to former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, with a combined balance of approximately Rs. 20 million, have been suspended by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Personal motor vehicle imports from February next year
byline: Import of motor vehicles for personal use will be allowed from February 1, 2025, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: Most polluted locations in Colombo identified
byline: Six locations in Colombo have been identified as highly polluted, according to the real-time Air Quality Index (AQI).

title: India spinner Ashwin retires from international cricket
byline: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his immediate retirement from international cricket following the third Test against Australia in Brisbane on Wednesday.

title: President in Parliament
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in Parliament to attend the sessions this morning.

title: Harsha appointed Chairman of Committee on Public Finance
byline: SJB MP Harsha de Silva has been appointed as Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (COPF), Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne announced today.

title: Nizam Kariapper sworn in as MP
byline: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) member Nizam Kariapper was sworn in as a national list MP before Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Expressway exits accept only local currency, inconveniencing tourists and locals
byline: Tourists and the local community face inconvenience when making payments at expressway toll gates, as they currently accept only Sri Lankan currency, the Daily Mirror has learnt.
